title: Blistered Broccolini with Charred Dates, Lemons & Sesame
directions: 1. Do some prep:- Trim about 1 inch from the stems of 1 pound broccolini. Halve any very thick stems lengthwise so that they are all about the same thickness.- Thinly slice half of the lemon into rounds (discard the thick pithy end). Cut each of those rounds into quarters. Reserve the remaining lemon half for squeezing later.- Tear ½ cup pitted Medjool dates into smaller bite-size pieces.

2. Get blisterin’:- Heat 3 tablespoons of the olive oil in a 12-inch cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat.- Add the broccolini and season with salt. Toss once or twice to coat, then cook undisturbed until charred in spots, 3 to 4 minutes. Toss again and cook another 3 to 4 minutes until bright green and tender.- Turn off the heat. Finely grate 1 garlic clove directly into the skillet and toss to coat. Taste and adjust seasoning. Transfer broccolini and any bits from the pan to a serving plate.- Return skillet to medium heat, add the lemon pieces, torn dates, and remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil. Cook undisturbed until lemons are caramelized and dates darkened, about 2 minutes.
3. Serve:- Scatter the caramelized lemons and dates over the broccolini. Drizzle with 1 teaspoon sesame oil and a good squeeze of lemon juice.
